intro: Mitrasacme aggregata, commonly known as the clustered mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests.
